question: 金持ち
sourceMnemonic: When you <kanji>hold</kanji> <kanji>gold</kanji> you are a <vocabulary>rich person</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Do you remember the word <ja>お金</ja>? This is the <ja>金</ja> in that word. The reading for <ja>持ち</ja> is the <ja>も</ja> you learned with <ja>持つ</ja>. So, combine the <ja>かね</ja> of <ja>お金</ja> and the <ja>持ち</ja> and you have the reading of this word. Note that just like <ja>お金</ja>, you'll often see this with the honorific prefix <ja>お</ja> in front of it as well.
